1.text: Hey there, sport! You’re still workin’ nights, huh? I’ve been comin’ here for years—same order, same smile. You remember me, right?

2.text: Ah, everyone says that at first. But you will. Folks around here always remember me eventually.

3.text: Ha! I knew it! You never forget a face like mine. Or was it the other way around?

options.text: 1. What do you mean by that?

4.text: Every night for a long, long time. Can’t beat your fries. They taste... nostalgic, like I’ve had them before. Over and over.

options.text: 1. You probably just like them a lot.

5.text: My name? Huh. Funny thing—nobody ever asks me that anymore. Guess it’s been a while since I needed one.

6.text: Creepy? Nah, I’m just friendly. Everyone in this town’s so jumpy lately. Like they’ve all got somethin’ to hide.

7.text: Yeah... maybe. Guess I’m just tired. Been comin’ here since I was a kid. Place used to have a clown mascot. Remember him?

options.text: 1. We haven’t had a mascot in years.

8.text: It’s weird, ain’t it? Every night feels the same. I pull up, order, wait, and someone new’s wearin’ your face.

9.text: Heh. Yeah. Maybe I do too. Maybe we all come here to forget what we were hungry for in the first place.

options.text: 1. You sound like you’ve lost something.

10.text: Then who’s been waving at me from behind the counter after hours?

11.text: Good. Then I’m not crazy. You’ve seen him too—the one with the grin that doesn’t move.

12.text: Lost somethin’? Nah. I just keep findin’ the same meal. The same faces. The same screams on the fryer oil. It’s all comfortin’, in a way.

options.text: 2. You’re not supposed to be here, are you?
